content: What famous American landmark was a gift from France to the United States in 1886?

The famous American landmark that was a gift from France to the United States in 1886 is the Statue of Liberty. This iconic statue, officially titled "Liberty Enlightening the World," was designed by French sculptor Frédéric Auguste Bartholdi and built by Gustave Eiffel. It was intended to commemorate the centennial of American independence and to honor the friendship between the two nations. The statue was assembled on Liberty Island in New York Harbor and has since become a symbol of freedom and democracy around the world.
